extendedIngredients.name: black pepper
extendedIngredients.originalString: ¼ tsp freshly ground black pepper

extendedIngredients.name: pecan pieces
extendedIngredients.originalString: 6 slices good-quality white bread, crusts removed, torn or diced into 1/4- to 1/2-inch pieces

extendedIngredients.name: sharp cheddar
extendedIngredients.originalString: 4 ½ cups (about 18 ounces) grated sharp white cheddar

extendedIngredients.name: unsalted butter
extendedIngredients.originalString: 8 tablespoons (1 stick) unsalted butter, plus more for dish

recipes.title: Martha’s Mac and Cheese

winePairing.pairingText: Lambrusco, Chenin Blanc, and Riesling are great choices for Macaroni and Cheese. With rich, cheesy mac & cheese you'll want to cleanse the palate with something crisp and acidic. We recommend Chenin Blanc, Riesling, or dry Lambrusco if you're in the mood for a red. You could try PRONTO Lambrusco Secco. Reviewers quite like it with a 5 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 20 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: PRONTO Lambrusco Secco
productMatches.description: Crimson purple color. Aromas are rich with purple iris, clove and licorice. Medium-bodied, dry (secco), excellent concentration, rich finish, abundant fruit, dry. This wine offers complexity and richness on the palate.

recipes.instructions: Heat the oven to 375° F. Butter a 3-quart casserole dish; set aside. Place bread pieces in a medium bowl. In a small saucepan over medium heat, melt 2 tablespoons butter. Pour butter into the bowl with bread, and toss. Set the bread pieces aside.Cook pasta 3 to 4 minutes less than the package instructions indicate.Meanwhile, in a medium saucepan set over medium heat, heat milk. Melt remaining 6 tablespoons butter in a high-sided skillet over medium heat. When butter bubbles, add flour. Cook, stirring, 1 minute.Slowly pour hot milk into flour-butter mixture while whisking. Continue cooking, whisking constantly, until the mixture bubbles and becomes thick.Remove the pan from the heat. Stir in salt, nutmeg, black pepper, cayenne pepper, 3 cups cheddar, and 1 ½ cups Gruyere. Set cheese sauce aside.Transfer the macaroni to a colander, rinse under cold running water, and drain well. Stir macaroni into the cheese sauce.Pour the mixture into the prepared casserole dish. Sprinkle remaining 1 ½ cups cheddar and ½ cup Gruyere; scatter bread pieces over the top. Bake until browned on top, about 30 minutes. Transfer dish to a wire rack to cool for 5 minutes; serve hot.

steps.step: Heat the oven to 375° F. Butter a 3-quart casserole dish; set aside.
Place bread pieces in a medium bowl. In a small saucepan over medium heat, melt 2 tablespoons butter.

Pour butter into the bowl with bread, and toss. Set the bread pieces aside.Cook pasta 3 to 4 minutes less than the package instructions indicate.Meanwhile, in a medium saucepan set over medium heat, heat milk. Melt remaining 6 tablespoons butter in a high-sided skillet over medium heat. When butter bubbles, add flour. Cook, stirring, 1 minute.Slowly pour hot milk into flour-butter mixture while whisking. Continue cooking, whisking constantly, until the mixture bubbles and becomes thick.
Remove the pan from the heat. Stir in salt, nutmeg, black pepper, cayenne pepper, 3 cups cheddar, and 1 ½ cups Gruyere. Set cheese sauce aside.
Transfer the macaroni to a colander, rinse under cold running water, and drain well. Stir macaroni into the cheese sauce.
Pour the mixture into the prepared casserole dish. Sprinkle remaining 1 ½ cups cheddar and ½ cup Gruyere; scatter bread pieces over the top.
Bake until browned on top, about 30 minutes.
Transfer dish to a wire rack to cool for 5 minutes; serve hot.
